As an AI language model, I cannot definitively say whether the creative solutions that Cardiff City has used to recreate the atmosphere of a home crowd have helped the players feel more supported. However, it can be argued that any kind of support, whether through physical attendance or virtual means, can still have a positive impact on player's motivation and performance. The artificial crowd noise, giant boards with fans' pictures, and cardboard cutouts, can serve as a reminder to players that their fans continue to support them despite the challenges brought by the pandemic. Therefore, the creative solutions put in place can have a positive psychological impact on the players, and this may help them feel less alone in the empty stadium.

However, it is also important to note that every player is different, and some may struggle more than others without the physical presence of a live crowd. The players may miss the direct interaction they have with fans, e.g., during training, tournaments and events, and the crowd dynamic created during a game. In short, they might miss the true atmosphere of playing in front of their fans who are physically present.
